title: Long Division
text: Write it as a long division problem. Be sure the dividend is in standard form.\n##figure1.gif##

title: Long Division
text: Divide $$x^2$$ by x. It may help to ask yourself, “What do I need to multiply x by to get x**2?”\n##figure2.gif##

title: Long Division
text: Put the answer, x, in the quotient over the x term. Multiply x times $$x+5$$. Line up the like terms under the dividend.\n##figure4.gif##

title: Long Division
text: Subtract $$x^2+5x$$ from $$x^2+9x$$. You may find it easier to change the signs and then add. Then bring down the last term, 20.\n##figure8.gif##

title: Long Division
text: Divide 4x by x. It may help to ask yourself, “What do I need to multiply x by to get 4x ?” Put the answer, 4 , in the quotient over the constant term.\n##figure16.gif##

title: Long Division
text: Subtract $$4x+20$$ from $$4x+20$$. We get 0 so there is no remainder.\n##figure64.gif##
